mid2tap

Class Generator

  • java.lang.Object
    • mid2tap.Generator

  • public class Generator
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains all functions for each part of the conversion process.

    • Method Detail

      • generatePlist

        public static int generatePlist(java.lang.String artist,
                java.lang.String song,
                java.lang.String theme,
                java.io.File outputFolder,
                java.io.File audioFile)
        Creates a new info.plist in the "artist - song.track" folder. Calculates the audio duration that is needed in the info.plist anyways. Writes what is mostly static data, adding in variables where needed.
        Parameters:
        artist - The artist specified by the user.
        song - The song specified by the user.
        theme - The theme specified by the user.
        outputFolder - The output folder specified by the user.
        audioFile - The audio specified by the user.
        Returns:
        The audio duration if plist creation was successful, -1 if plist creation was unsuccessful.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - caught if the file cannot be written to.

      • audioLength

        public static int audioLength(java.io.File audioFile)
        Calculates the audio duration by reading the audio file header.
        Parameters:
        audioFile - The audio the user specified.
        Returns:
        The audio duration if successful, -1 if unsuccessful.
        Throws:
        org.jaudiotagger.audio.exceptions.CannotReadException - Caught if the file cannot be read.
        org.jaudiotagger.tag.TagException - Caught if the audio tags are invalid.
        org.jaudiotagger.audio.exceptions.ReadOnlyFileException - Caught if the file is read-only.
        org.jaudiotagger.audio.exceptions.InvalidAudioFrameException - Caught if a frame in the audio is invalid
        java.io.IOException - Caught if the file cannot be read.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - Caught if the file path is invalid.

      • generateArtwork

        public static void generateArtwork(java.io.File artworkFile,
                   java.io.File outputFolder)
        Takes the artwork the user specified, resizes it to 64x64 and 128x128, and copies it to the "artist - song.track" folder.
        Parameters:
        artworkFile - The artwork file specified by the user.
        outputFolder - The output folder specified by the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Caught if the artwork file cannot be read or written

      • generateAudio

        public static void generateAudio(java.io.File audioFile,
                 java.io.File outputFolder)
        Copies the audio file and renames it to "audio.m4a". Tap Tap Revenge still reads MP3 files renamed to an M4A extension.
        Parameters:
        audioFile - The audio file specified by the user.
        outputFolder - The output folder specified by the user.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Caught if the file cannot be read or written.

      • parseMidi

        public static java.util.LinkedList<Note> parseMidi(java.io.File eofFile)
        Parses the MIDI file by recording every track and the note values on them. Ignores any data in the tracks that does not contain a note.
        Parameters:
        eofFile - The MIDI file specified by the user.
        Returns:
        A linked list of the notes.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Caught if the MIDI cannot be read.

      • generateTTR2

        public static void generateTTR2(int audioDuration,
                java.io.File eofFile,
                java.io.File outputFolder,
                java.lang.String artist,
                java.lang.String song)
        Creates the taptrack file by first parsing the MIDI file and then writing both constant and variable data.
        Parameters:
        audioDuration - The duration of the song.
        eofFile - The MIDI file specified by the user.
        outputFolder - The output folder specified by the user.
        artist - The artist specified by the user.
        song - The song specified by the user.

      • getTimePerTick

        public static double getTimePerTick(java.io.File eofFile,
                    javax.sound.midi.Sequence sequence)
        Calculate time per tick. This is used to convert from MIDI ticks to real time If this method is expanded, it is possible to check for varying BPM and calculate the real time according to BPM change.
        Parameters:
        eofFile - The MIDI file specified by the user.
        sequence - The MIDI sequence for which the calculations are being made.
        Returns:
        The real time per MIDI tick.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Caught if the file cannot be read.
